column4: Hello, I am a new Ubuntu user. I have installed wine so i can emulate a 2d game I really like to play. Anyways the game is a java based game and seems to be running really choppy. What can I do to improve the performance?
some reason the java game cant work with the normal java? thats sort of the point of java
IF its written right
it's written in java but there is a client installer, packed with dll's and crap.
what game is this anyway?
Darkquest. It's a runescape classic remake :P (dunno if you ever heard of it)
I belvie ive gotten runescape working in my browser.. but perhaps that was a diffrent variant.
yes, it was different. This has an installer, which installs the client.
No clue why it's so choppy
running java in wine  sounds like a good reason to be choppy
hmm the runescape web site sent working for me now either.. it used to.. months ago
http://www.darkq.org/client/Darkquest_installer.exe
if you are interested
i got the  web runescape going.. and i rember why i never played it.. :P
yes I agree hehe. I just have alot of old friends that play, I help them develop graphics for this "re-make" game so to say
when I play it's really choppy, but this isn't the web based. This is a client that is installed.
pyru yes. i see that.. i cant even login because i got no account :)  it seems to be using 'jet' some sort of comercial Java-add-on-thinggie.. so good luck
i can create you an account very quickly if you would like?
i just uninstalled the game. :)
awe =( heh just made a test account
